data.title: Some file keep building even when no changes happen (MinGW)
data.body:
When I'm building Urho from source, some files are keep building even when I don't change anything. This is really annoying when I just want to run or debug my build, it can take up to 3:50 minutes on my PC. I don't remember when this happen, I think it was since last week or something.

Do anyone know about this problem?

Screenshot of my building process:
![build_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5253453/14632639/0b0fd308-0644-11e6-972c-de723bb452c5.png)
As you can see, the problem lies on OggVorbisSoundstream.cpp, Sound.cpp, Image.cpp, and RampGenerator.cpp

data.title: Enable Ninja for Windows Systems
data.body:
This enables the Ninja build tool to work on Windows again on both Mingw and MSVC.

If the generator is Ninja disable precompiled headers. <- This commit disables precompiled headers if you are using Ninja. It is slightly hacky. 

Please suggest improvements.

data.title: Add additional Variant Types For ScriptInstance::Execute()
data.body: I noticed that some variant types that have objects exposed to the AngelScript subsystem are not captured as type of parameters that can be passed when calling an AngelScript function from C++. This implementation rectifies it.

data.title: Fix cubemap seams for OpenGL version
TmxFile using deprecated file format
data.body:
The TmxFile loading implementation is using uncompressed XML and was [officially deprecated](http://forum.mapeditor.org/t/tiled-0-15-0-released/1001) by @bjorn in January. This means any maps saved with version 0.15.0+ will not load. 

This was also [mentioned in a PR](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/pull/641#issuecomment-106905685) and suggested to support an alternate format, preferably the default of the latest version as Tiled is getting closer to 1.0.

data.title: Added ResourceCache::ReleaseResource<T> similar to GetResource<T>
data.body:
Added template version of ReleaseResource similar to the GetResource function.

```
template <class T> void ResourceCache::ReleaseResource(const String& name, bool force)
```

This makes unloading resources easier and similar to the "common" loading.

data.title: Arbitrary vertex declarations
data.body:
This implements arbitrary vertex declaration support (issue #707), where you can decide the order, type and semantic of your vertex elements. This allows up to 4 UV coordinate sets.

For compatibility, you can still use the "legacy" vertex element masks when defining vertex buffers. The need to specify buffer binding element masks is eliminated altogether, rather if you want to override some elements with another buffer (for example positions from a morph vertex buffer) the override buffer simply has to use a higher index in Geometry or Graphics::SetVertexBuffers().

Multiple input element semantics in vertex shaders are zero-based, e.g. iTexCoord would be the first (index 0) texcoord and iTexCoord1 would be second. D3D defines semantics explicitly but in GLSL it's based on string compare of the vertex attribute name.

A new model format (UMD2) which uses vertex element declarations instead of element mask is introduced. AssetImporter will save using this format.

Testing is appreciated. I'll still have to test morphs, which could have bugs yet, and whether Android / iOS / Emscripten works, but I'm opening this for early review in any case.

data.title: Shader animation bug.
data.body:
Changed the conditions when unsubscribes the shader animation events.
Or it will unsubcribe all the events if you call SetShaderParameterAnimation function twice. (For example, you need to animate texture U and V )

data.title: AppleTV port of Urho3D
data.body: I already have a working AppleTV port in my local branch based on the earlier SDL-2.0.4-upgrade branch. It needs some additional works to bring the port up to speed. Once that done, we shall test build it using our CI server. Currently we have both 32-bit and 64-bit iOS CI jobs, the 32-bit iOS CI job is now redundant because the 64-bit version actually also build armv7 arch (universal build). So, 32-bit iOS CI job will be replaced with 64-bit tvOS CI job.

data.title: Consider phasing out D3D9?
data.body: With the recent texture array commits, a divergence has been created between the render system branches, with D3D9 unable to support arrays. This has caused an issue with the Lua bindings. I think it might be simpler going forward to simply phase out D3D9 support altogether. Thoughts?

data.title: Occluder sorting improvement
Parallel Building
data.body:
Currently Urho3D does not take advantage of parallel building which modern compilers support.
Using single core compilation have no advantages over multicore compilation therefore we should enable it by default when possible.
Microsoft introduced parallel building support (**/MP**) in Visual C++ 2010 and above. _Make sure minimal rebuild is disabled_.
On other build tools (make, ninja) there is **-j** parameter (I think ninja have it enabled by default).

For more informations:
https://blog.kitware.com/cmake-building-with-all-your-cores/

```
CMake Error at CMake/Modules/FindDirectX.cmake:78 (file):
  file STRINGS file

  CMakeLists.txt:50 (include)


CMake Error at CMake/Modules/FindDirectX.cmake:84 (message):

Call Stack (most recent call first):

  CMakeLists.txt:50 (include)
```

I feel this is related to #1247 and #1251 .
